question: Where took place the Battle of Jutland ?

answers.text: Fought in the North Sea, near Jutland, Denmark, the Battle of Jutland was the largest naval battle and only full scale clash of battleships during the First World War. The German fleet, commanded by Vice-Admiral Reinhard Scheer, attempted to lure a portion of the British Grand Fleet, led by Admiral Sir John Jellicoe, into a trap. However, in the course of battle, both forces suffered significant losses, and British dominance of the North sea was ultimately maintained.

British Grand Fleet confronts the German High Seas Fleet in the North Sea, off the coast of Denmark. Although the British lose more ships, the German fleet is driven back to port and remains there for the rest of the war.

Fought in the North Sea, near Jutland, Denmark, the Battle of Jutland was the largest naval battle and only full scale clash of battleships during the First World War. The German fleet, commanded by Vice-Admiral Reinhard Scheer, attempted to lure a portion of the British Grand Fleet, led by Admiral Sir John Jellicoe, into a trap. However, in the course of battle, both forces suffered significant losses, and British dominance of the North sea was ultimately maintained.

During the Allied invasion of Gallipoli, British and French forces landed at Suvla Bay hoping to press inland and assist Anzac troops in the Battle of Gallipoli. However, poor management and the Ottoman defense inflicted heavy casualties on Allied troops. Eventually reinforced, Allied forces pressed forward, and launched the Battle of Scimitar Hill. This failure, however, decimated the Gallipoli campaign, and after several small battles the Allies ultimately withdrew from Suvla.
